meanings.definition: Showing the signs of age; old-fashioned or out-of-date.
meanings.sent1: The jacket he wore was very dated, with large shoulder pads.
meanings.sent2: Her hairstyle looked dated compared to the modern trends.
meanings.sent3: The old computer was so dated, it could barely run any new software.
meanings.sent4: His taste in music was so dated, he only listened to vinyl records.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop was full of dated furniture from the 1960s.

meanings.definition: To determine or note the time of an event or object.
meanings.sent1: She dated the letter by writing the exact day on it.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist dated the artifacts to the Roman era.
meanings.sent3: He tried to date the ancient manuscript but found it challenging.
meanings.sent4: The scientist used carbon dating to accurately date the fossil.
meanings.sent5: The historian was able to date the painting to the Renaissance period.

meanings.definition: To go on a date with someone.
meanings.sent1: They dated for a few months before deciding to be just friends.
meanings.sent2: She agreed to date him after getting to know him better.
meanings.sent3: He asked her out to date, but she politely declined.
meanings.sent4: They planned to date at the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent5: The couple decided to date exclusively after a few weeks of seeing each other.
